remarks: A Dedekind cut is arithmetically located.  This is a variation of ~ prarloc which only constructs one (named) point and is therefore often easier to work with.  It states that given a tolerance ` P ` , there are elements of the lower and upper cut which are exactly that tolerance from each other.  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 26-Dec-2019.)
statement:
prarloc2 $p |- ( ( <. L , U >. e. P. /\ P e. Q. ) -> E. a e. L ( a +Q P ) e. U ) $.
$d L a $.
$d P a $.
$d U a $.
